techmeme.title: OpenAI says safety researchers can sign up for o3 preview today and it did not name the new model o2 "out of respect" for the UK telecom brand (Bloomberg)
OpenAI unveils o3 and o3-mini, trained to "think" before responding via what OpenAI calls a "private chain of thought", and plans to launch them early next year (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
Grindr will cover as much as $300,000 in fertility, surrogacy, and adoption costs for staffers who have been at the company for 18+ months, starting next year (Kelsey Butler/Bloomberg)
Sam Altman says Elon Musk is "clearly a bully" who is suing OpenAI because the startup is doing really well and calls the lawsuits "a little bit of a sideshow" (Fortune)

Experts say Apple's spyware notifications for victims are a game changer for research; the notifications direct the victims to nonprofit security lab Access Now (Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai/TechCrunch)
